TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1054
TEI.2.document_title: James Cummins to Stephen F. Austin, 03-03-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: James Cummins to Austin, March 3, 1825. Concerning land.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1054

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*James Cummins to Austin, March 3, 1825. Concerning land.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"* *p**date_mentioned n="03-03-1825">March 3d 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr Friend*/p*
*p*I Recd a note from my *person_mentioned*brother John*/person_mentioned* he States he cald to See moore respecting that land and he told him that he was a bout to let it go to *person_mentioned*Col. Groce*/person_mentioned* he wished me to See you a mediately respecting it if there is any posibility of Saving it you will please drop me a few lines what I am to do I will go up and bring him down if necessary, my time does not admit of my Coming down at this time*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*James Cummins*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col. S F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p* */div1*
